casebody.data:
Kirby against Cogswell.

After certificate to stay proceedings, both parties may notice for argument.

It was ruled in this cause, that, after a certificate [*485] of probable *cause, to stay proceedings, both parties may notice for argument, and that the not entering and noticing for argument by the party obtaining the certificate to stay, is no cause for a motion to discharge the order; Vide ante, 343, especially if made without notice.
